intro: Aiouea heteranthera, commonly known as the variable anther tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and avocado trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often glossy and elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically appearing in clusters at the base of the leaves. The fruit is a small, dark-colored drupe that contains a single seed.
